caption: One of the most beautiful palaces in Europe. The 400 year history is being celebrated this year 2025.  The history is beautifully displayed in many of the state apartments which are open to the general public. I highly recommend the King‚Äôs Private Chambers tour which takes you to other areas. If your guide can sneak you into the Theatre, it is amazing. You should pre buy a times ticket as it gets very busy. I bought a years pass for two as we are going 3 times during our stay and it makes better financial sense.

The palace is stunning. A must visit if you have time in Paris. The palace offers so many portraits, chandeliers, lights and marvelous rooms all decorated and well kept. The highlight of the palace is the long courtyard of chandeliers and mirrors all glistening. There are so many spots to click photos, the place gets really crowded, come early in the morning to visit this best leisurely manner. Go for it üëçüèªü§©

This place is amazing. We spent the whole day there, and there were still a lot of things we hadn't seen. I would recommend bringing along your earbuds, as the palace has an official app that introduces each room in the palace. You can also take the mini train to explore the garden, there are a few stops for this train.

Visiting the Palace of Versailles was an unforgettable experience, despite the long wait and large crowds. The sheer grandeur of the palace is overwhelming, and stepping inside feels like stepping back in time to the days of French royalty. The history that surrounds the palace is incredible, and it‚Äôs hard not to imagine the opulence that King Louis XIV enjoyed while living here.  The wait to get in was a bit much‚Äîover an hour to get through security and into the palace itself. And once inside, it‚Äôs definitely crowded, with tourists from all over the world trying to take in the beauty of the place. However, despite the hustle and bustle, it‚Äôs easy to lose yourself in the history and the stunning architecture that surrounds you.  The Hall of Mirrors is undoubtedly one of the most iconic rooms, with its gleaming chandeliers, intricate mirrors, and beautiful gardens visible through the windows. Every room in the palace is a masterpiece, from the lavishly decorated royal apartments to the ornate ceilings that tell stories of France‚Äôs rich past. The attention to detail in every corner is simply astounding.  While the experience may be a bit challenging with the crowds and wait times, the history, the beauty, and the sheer scale of the Palace of Versailles make it more than worth it. It‚Äôs a must-visit for anyone who wants to immerse themselves in France's royal heritage and experience one of the most historically significant landmarks in Europe.

Such a memorable experience, the restoration and maintenance of this property is unbelievable. It was like taking a step back in time. Everything was preserved so well and I really appreciate detail to keeping everything original. It was beautiful. The sculptures and busts looked great in person and I would love to come back again. Highly recommend

It was an unforgettable experience. The way the property has been restored and maintained is truly remarkable. It felt like stepping back in time. Everything was preserved so beautifully, and I really appreciated the attention to detail in keeping it all original. It was stunning. The sculptures and busts looked even more impressive in person, and I‚Äôd love to visit again. I highly recommend it.

Get ready and put on your walking shoes.  I enjoyed this visit over the Louvre.  Our guide told the history and brought the palace to live as we wondered in amazement. After the tour, we walked the gardens. It is best to see in April or May so you can enjoy the blossoms and perfectly manicured landscaping. Go beyond the gardens and visit Grand Triton and the Hamlet

It‚Äôs a magnificent castle, I always go there and it never gets boring. I absolutely love every details of this castle it‚Äôs very nice to visit and it‚Äôs a great place to visit when coming to Paris. Would mostly recommend not going on weekends because there are too much people if you‚Äôd like a more chill visit.

Lots of people.  I cannot imagine what summer must be like.  Would recommend having a guide and group tour to avoid lines and learn more.  They have audio guides if you come on your own.  With the gardens you could spend all day but our tour was 2.5 hours.

Come during the off season and get there early had the 10:00am slot , a little busy but there were some areas that were still quiet. Was there all day till around 5:30pm, I suggest bringing lunch the cafe is nice but isn‚Äôt great. Also have comfortable walking shoes!

The palace of Versailles is an unimaginable wonder like no other. A short ride outside Paris, it is a must see. Many companies offer day trips, it is definitely worth it. Make sure you add the gardens as they are a wonder to be held themselves. Also ensure you get the audio tour as walking around the palace without the audio tour would be difficult.

This experience was unique. You had to be there to feel it. For me was the first time visiting. I think that you need 3-4 days to really see all of it. Now the gardens are not green. The best time is in the summer, but there is a lot of people.

Highly recommend a tour of the palace of versailles and the gardens. Absolutely stunning so much history. One of the best things to do in paris. The architecture was breathtaking. All the portraits And The Hall of Mirrors a must-see. A lot of guided group tours, so try to do a smaller tour. Wait times can be up to an hour or more. Going during the weekday I highly suggest.

Wonder what this magnificent an enormous palace may have looked like in the 18th and 19th century in all its glory.  Worth the visit. Loved all the exhibits. Bought some beautiful souvenirs from the gift shop. You won‚Äôt be able to resist. Was a bit pricey but I liked it.  The audio guide was super helpful. It would be nice to have WiFi

A must visit place! We visited this during weekday (Wed) and chose 9:30am. I would def suggest getting the earliest time. Even though there is a 9am queue, we‚Äôre able to enter few minutes later after the first batch entered. The staff were really helpful and organized. We went straight ahead to the hall of mirrors to take photos therefore if you want to take pictures with less people, go straight to this area first. ‚ù§Ô∏è

My visit to the Palace of Versailles was nothing short of magical. From the moment I entered the majestic grounds, I was transported back to a time of opulence and grandeur. The intricate architecture of the palace  Each room seemed to tell its own story, with beautifully preserved furnishings and artwork that provided a glimpse into the lavish lifestyle of French royalty.  The King's Grand Apartments were particularly impressive, showcasing the finest examples of 17th-century decor and design.  The gardens of Versailles were equally captivating. The meticulously manicured lawns, vibrant flowerbeds, and tranquil fountains created a serene and picturesque setting.  I spent hours wandering through the endless pathways, discovering charming groves and hidden statues along the way. The Grand Canal added to the charm, offering a peaceful spot to sit and admire the beauty of the surroundings.  One of the highlights of my visit was the musical fountain show.  Overall, my experience at the Palace of Versailles was truly unforgettable. The combination of historical grandeur, artistic beauty, and serene landscapes made it a perfect day trip from Paris.  Versailles is a must-visit destination. Highly recommend taking a guided tour to fully appreciate the rich history and hidden gems of this iconic palace."

An impressive chateau displaying art of the last three kings of France. A 15-minute walk from the train stations. If you visit it in winter, in order or visit the gardens and Petit Trianon, wear warm clothes. Crepes are quite expensive to the shops close to the monument. Enjoy art and history.

The palace of Versailles is a famous, opulent palace in Paris, with enormous, stunning gardens. Inside, the details are definitely overwhelming and there  is certainly a lot of eye candy. Frescoes  cover the ceiling, statues are everywhere and there is intricate, artistic work from floor to ceiling. The architecture of the building, gates and grounds were very impressive as well. One hall is all mirrored glass.  It was extremely packed when we visited, which was unfortunate, as it was very difficult to move inside and follow our tour group. There were definitely too many people inside and it ruined the experience for me, as I was really looking forward to seeing the palace. They do not keep count of the number of tourists that they let in at one time and it feels like you are a sardine in a can in some rooms.  A tourist from another tour group actually hissed at me, if you can believe it. Another tourist was snarky to my wife. Groups do get to skip ahead of the line as well, but it doesn‚Äôt help with the overcrowding. Expect rude behaviour because of the crowds. It would actually be easier not to be in a tour group, as you have to try and keep together.  The grounds on the other hand, were an absolute joy and I suggest spending more time outdoors enjoying them, if it is crowded inside. The statues, fountains and water features are absolutely stunning. After the experience inside, it was much more enjoyable to be outside in the fresh air.  I suggest planning on spending the majority of your time enjoying the immense gardens, as it‚Äôs a sight to see. Try to hit it on the off season.
Amazing building and rooms. Gardens are impressive. Only downside was the number of tourists in the actual Palace, very difficult to move round with ease.

The crowd is manageable at Sunday 9am. Short queue to enter the palace but move fast. Crowd built up very quickly so I suggest to come early, and remember to wear a comfy shoes! Its a long hilly stroll at the garden after the palace, choose a good weather and don‚Äôt miss it üå≤üå≥

The tour of Versailles Palace was an immersive and enriching experience, providing a captivating journey through French history and culture.  As I stepped into the vast grandeur of the palace, I was immediately transported back in time to the opulent world of French royalty.  The intricate details of the architecture, luxurious furnishings, and exquisite artwork clearly illustrate why Versailles Palace is celebrated as a symbol of power and prestige.   While exploring the lavish halls and chambers, I couldn't help but feel in awe of the craftsmanship and design that define each room.  From the Hall of Mirrors to the King‚Äôs Apartments, every corner of the palace exudes a sense of history and significance.  Our tour guides offered insightful commentary, illuminating the historical events and personalities that shaped the palace‚Äôs legacy.  In addition to the magnificent interior, the sprawling gardens of Versailles were a stunning sight to behold. The meticulously manicured landscapes, ornate fountains, and grand statues created a tranquil oasis that offers a striking contrast to the palace's grandeur.   The place is overly crowded, and it is rather difficult to concentrate and value the time of admiring the beauty of the rooms and history.  It's a place worth visiting. One of the downsides of the visit is the limited number of restrooms. They are overly crowded with a long queue.  I wish they would address this challenge for the sick and elderly.

I definitely would recommend visiting if you're in Paris, the palace is beautiful, but I didn't realise quite the extent of the grounds and the other houses that are included in the visit. Just be aware that the sculptures in the grounds will be covered in the off season and the fountains will not be on.

Visit the entire palace before considering going to the gardens, don‚Äôt make the same mistake than us, who thought the gardens were something part of the ticket, and we went out thinking we could get in again to finish our tour. Fortunately, after some facepalms, they allowed us to get in again.

Absolutely amazing, a beautiful site filled with history. To truly appreciate everything it has to offer, I recommend giving yourself at least two days to visit, especially if you're going outside of winter. The gardens are a highlight. If you're short on time, the small "train" is a convenient option to explore more of the estate before it closes. For a well-planned visit, I suggest starting with the Trianon. While it's interesting, it‚Äôs less impressive compared to the main palace. This approach lets you maximize your time exploring the true gems of Versailles, such as the Hall of Mirrors and the ornate royal apartments. Versailles is a must-see destination for anyone passionate about history, art, or architecture.

üåü **An Unforgettable Experience at the Palace of Versailles** üåü  Visiting the Palace of Versailles was like stepping into a real-life fairy tale. The grandeur and opulence of the palace and its gardens are simply unmatched. We bought our tickets online in advance, which I highly recommend as it saves time on the day of your visit. However, be prepared for long wait lines even with pre-purchased tickets. The sheer number of visitors is a testament to the palace's global allure.  The audio guide provided excellent historical context, enhancing our appreciation for the intricate details and artistry in every room. We were approximately 75% through our tour when an unexpected turn of events occurred‚Äîwe were evacuated due to a suspected bomb threat (as the media had relayed it). While this was a bit unsettling, the evacuation process was handled swiftly and professionally by the staff, ensuring everyone's safety.  Despite the disruption, the experience was still incredible. The Hall of Mirrors, the King's Grand Apartments, and the sprawling gardens left us in awe. The palace's beauty and historical significance are truly worth the visit.  Pro Tip: **Buy your tickets in advance and plan to arrive early to maximize your time at this magnificent site.** The wait lines can be long, but trust me, the experience is absolutely worth it.  Overall, our visit to the Palace of Versailles was unforgettable, and we're already planning to return to explore the parts we missed. Highly recommended for anyone visiting France! üè∞üá´üá∑

Make sure to reserve a ticket in advance. Recommend to choose early morning slot. You still need to wait in the long line at the front even you reserve the ticket but it will save a lot of time. But this worth the wait. You will see a lot of rooms inside. Also taking an audio guide is recommended.

This palace alongside Louvre is the epitome of classical art and architecture, every room in the palace feels like an incredible art studio traversing the dimensions of time. I didn't get to see the gardens in full bloom unfortunately in the winter season but on the bright side that guarantees a revisit in the future

Overwhelmingly beautiful, inside and out. The opulence is amazing! We loved exploring the huge gardens. Fountain shows were lovely. Recommend the 9am entry for fewer people to start with, arrive 45 to 30 minutes early to be near the front of the queue, which grows unbelievably quickly. Even with all the people, it didn‚Äôt feel overcrowded and had some good photo opportunities.

A very big palace, a combination of art & power. Very crowded and long queue on the weekend but worth the wait. Very easy to access the location using public transportation. Beautiful place to visit üëçüëçüëç ‚Ä¶

Beautiful but crowded! In the Summer time you‚Äôll stand in line while burning in the sun. Inside there‚Äôs a lot to See and everything looks very stunning. Tickets are free for everyone under 26 years old and residence in the European Union.

The Palace of Versailles is a breathtaking testament to France‚Äôs royal history and architectural grandeur. The stunning Hall of Mirrors, with its glittering chandeliers and intricate detailing, is a highlight that transports you to the opulence of the 17th century. The gardens are equally spectacular, with meticulously manicured lawns, fountains, and sculptures that stretch endlessly, offering a serene escape. Don‚Äôt miss the Trianon palaces and Marie Antoinette‚Äôs Estate for a glimpse into more intimate royal spaces. While the crowds can be overwhelming, especially during peak hours, the experience is absolutely worth it. I recommend booking tickets in advance and visiting early in the morning. A truly unforgettable experience

Versailles Palace was hands down the best part of my trip to France. The paintings inside were mesmerizing, each one telling its own story, and the furniture in the King and Queen‚Äôs rooms was incredibly detailed and elegant‚Äîit really felt like stepping back in time. The architecture was just as impressive, with every corner showcasing the palace‚Äôs grandeur and craftsmanship. Even the neighborhood around the palace had its own charm, with lovely streets that added to the whole experience. It‚Äôs a place that feels magical both inside and out‚Äîa visit I‚Äôll never forget.
Very cool! Nice to visit and we loved seeing the stories of the families who lived at the palace. The grounds are extensive and beautiful.

Great palace full of France's history. I disliked the fact that there were a few toilets compared to the great number of visitors so there were bigger lines here than waiting outside. Also, there are no benches in the gardens. Big plus for the Guillaume Bresson exhibition!

10/13/2024  We took a bike tour of the grounds which was really fun. The gardens are amazing. Inside the palace it is very opulent as one would expect, but that really isn't something I enjoy. But being out in the gardens made up for the inside. It was very busy but I was told it was a light day, so I can't imagine how busy it normally is on a Sunday.  I would love to go back and take my kids to the garden, especially Marie Antoinette's village, so cute.

We expected the Chateau to be less busy at this time of the year, but even with low crowds, it was uncomfortably crowded. We bought our ticket with the tiny tram which was the best idea of the day! We brought a lunch as there was little food to be found. Be advised that you must eat before you enter the grounds. Otherwise you will wait for your picnic until you are completely done with your visit since McT once you leave the building, you may not return. Purchase your tickets online to avoid the very long lines.

Palace is nice. But garden in my opinion is much better so expect to spend more time there. Especially if you are into outdoors and gardening. Walked around for 1.30 hours  I could have easily spent another 2 hours there. Will make an effort to go again on my own instead of a tour. Tour is average unless you really care about the history.

I visited during summer time and it was hot and humid as expected. Check for tickets available first as you may not be able to go inside the palaces. Nonetheless you visit the garden and surrounding areas. Take cash for the public transportation, the bus is affordable but you won‚Äôt get anywhere without cash, even taxis only take cash. I learned the hard way.
